1.text: Know the goal of the game to keep track of the rules.

2.text: Create a grid of dots at least four dots wide and four dots long.

3.text: Give each player a pencil or pen.

4.text: Flip a coin, play rock-paper-scissors, or otherwise decide who gets to go first.

5.text: Each turn, draw one horizontal or vertical line to connect two dots.

6.text: Draw the 4th wall of a box to win it for yourself.

7.text: Take an extra turn if you complete a box.

8.text: Count up each player's number of boxes once the whole board is covered.

9.text: Play the game using free internet programs, alternatively.

10.text: Avoid creating the third side of a box until you absolutely have to.

11.text: Keep track of the length of a "run," trying to give away the shortest chains possible.

12.text: Let your opponent win the last two boxes in any chain longer than three squares.

13.text: Force good opponents into giving you the first chain.

14.text: Think about cordoning off sections of the board when trying to force the right number of chains.

15.text: Sacrifice a chain to reset the count if you're pre-determined to lose.
